content: The MSI GeForce RTX 5080 Suprim SOC has a clean design, good temperatures, and is very quiet under load. Terrific design overall.
The Gigabyte GeForce RTX 5080 Gaming OC is not my pick because Gigabyte needs to use better fans since they get very loud.
The Inno3D GeForce RTX 5080 iChill X3 review shows it is powerful and cool.
The Palit GeForce RTX 5080 GameRock OC has rocking looks!
The card's potent AI hardware and cutting-edge AI features will only improve its standing as they gain support.
The MSI GeForce RTX 5080 SUPRIM SOC offers solid 4K performance, but at a steep price. It's only 22% faster than the RTX 4080.
Based on benchmarks, the GeForce RTX 5080 is on average 12.9% faster.
The NVIDIA GeForce RTX 5080 is a 4K gaming powerhouse GPU with next-level gaming with DLSS 4.
The MSI GeForce RTX 5080 VANGUARD SOC offers great 4K performance and cool, quiet operation. However, it doesn't reach RTX 4090 levels.
The Gigabyte GeForce RTX 5080 Aero OC SFF is a subtle and small graphics card and a stunner.
I've been gaming with a GeForce RTX 5080 for months, and it's one efficient, stealthy frame hunter of a GPU.
The Palit GeForce RTX 5080 GameRock OC is the best of the RTX 5080s.
MSI GeForce RTX 5080 SUPRIM SOC is overclocked and ready for 4K Gaming.
Here is 1440p Ultra with DLAA, no frame gen on an RTX 5080 and it's mostly positive.
The RTX 5080 reviews are out and it falls just short of the RTX 4090 for $600 less!
The Asus ROG Astral GeForce RTX 5080 OC Edition is beautiful, bulky, and bewilderingly expensive.
Nvidia's RTX 5080 is a $1,000 GPU that feels more like an RTX 4080 Ti Super than a true next-gen upgrade.
Stick with an RTX 5080 instead of RTX 5090 from looking like a massive waste of money.
I Can't Put a Positive Spin on the RTX 5080.
I've read that the RTX 5080 should be about the same speed or slightly faster than an RTX 3090.
The 5080 in Australia starts at $2199, while the 4080 is $1549. It's $600 more for only 8% performance.
The 5080 seems like a minor upgrade, similar to the RX 480 to RX 580. Not close to a 4090.
AMD has a golden opportunity to gain market share by outperforming Nvidia in pure raster performance this generation.
Should I upgrade from my 3080 to a 4080 or 4090 instead of a 5080?
The 5080 with GDDR6x would be slower than the 4080 Super! It's a step backwards, wait for a refresh.
In Australia, the 5080 sells for $2000 and is selling out, even with only 10% more performance.
Upgrading from a 40 series GPU to a 50 series might not be worth it unless you sell the old one.
I bought a 4080 Super and I'm happy I didn't wait for the 5000 series.
Measured at 1440p, so CPU bottlenecks. At 4k it goes up to 15% performance gain.
There's no real reason to buy new or sell old cards, meaning cards will hold value longer. Good for 7800XT owners.
The 16 with the 5080 has 16GB VRAM, helpful for editing. Intel CPU/GPU encodes faster than AMD.
The temps are great and with an undervolt/OC it's slightly quieter and quicker.
My goal was to buy this GPU for my black/white theme. I am well pleased.
Stock clock speed doesn't matter because you should overclock anyway for extra performance.
I've had it for 5 months. It's a great card. I'm very satisfied!
